descript.abstract: (2009) Cleveland,OH area natural color seamless orthoimagery acquired by Aerials Express at a 30cm pixel-resolution. Flight operations began (9/17/09) and ended (11/8/09) using an (DMC) camera with an approximate forward overlap of 60% and side overlap of 30% with an approximate Ground Sample Distance of (28 cm). The dataset is projected as Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) 17 on the North American Datum of 1983. The 7.5-minute National Elevation Dataset 7.5-minutes was utilized as the Digital Elevlation Model in ortho-processing.
descript.purpose: Aerial imagery is a critical geospatial data component for strategically identifying, planning, preparing, and responding in the service and protection of the United States and its people. This dataset includes imagery of areas within North America including major and secondary urban centers. Obtaining a regional coverage allows government entities an interoperable common operating picture during a critical event or in pre or post planning.

place.placekey: United States, State of Ohio, Carroll County, Cuyahoga County, Geauga County, Huron County, Jefferson County, Lake County, Lorian County, Medina County, Portage County, Stark County, Summit County, Wayne County, City of Cleveland

idinfo.useconst: The vendor will grant to NGA a perpetual and non-transferable license to the 2009 high-resolution digital orthoimagery for the purposes of any project or process related to NGA Homeland Security business. NGA may provide the orthoimagery to appropriate Federal, state and local emergency response agencies as deemed necessary for Homeland Security purposes by NGA. Aerials Express will allow for distribution to Federal Civil and contain no cost uplift to an unrestricted distribution license within four months of the date that the imagery was shipped to point of contact named. USGS may place the data on one of The National Map servers prior to the uplift to public domain limited to view only (no download).

The 7.5-minute National Elevation Dataset 7.5-minutes was utilized as the Digital Elevlation Model in ortho-processing.

dataqual.complete: Data set has been visually inspected. All data produced strives to meet National Mapping Accuracy Standards (NMAS).

digtinfo.formname: ESRI data format, dependent upon request

stdorder.fees: To be determined at time of order
